text: As I understand, "bogan" is Australian for "white trash."

name: drskradley
text: Yeah, basically.  Think mullets, flannelette shirts, V8's, Nickelback and hip hop, and a allegiance to either Ford or Holden (Chevy is the US equivalent).  Cheap beer and cask wine.

text: A comment left by retardo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ewin, katal, reverendtmac, chochacho, FablesandBlues, atticusonline, Carrot, vexingrupert, nipsy43, LaserBlade, Abrahamdrinkin, Wulvaine, kenyot, smilebuddha, yingkaixing, yaegmenthor, stormagnet, Mastronaut, tellumo)

name: killerlimpet
text:
"Do you think he's reading this stuff? I don't think he is."

.... and yet you keep addressing him...

name: rowboat
text: Whether or not anybody finds retardo's posts entertaining (and I must say that part of me does), this is not spam, people! This is why you've been granted the power to lame! If you don't like reading his comments, just lame it and set your level to 1. Marking it as spam, which it clearly is not, is unfair to people who want to see what everybody writes here. He's not trying to sell you a god damned calling plan! Lame him, ignore him as a user or just fire back at him if you want, but let the rest of us decide for ourselves!

name: diggidy
text: I would have to disagree with you rowboat.  Spam is not limited to ads.  If I continually make the same basic comment, that's also a form of spam.  And the more obnoxious it is, the more likely people are to recognize it as such.  retardo fits that category to a T.

name: rowboat
text:
That sounds reasonable enough, though I would still argue that he put more thought into his posts than the average spammer even if his comments were all in the same vein. Now manflesh, he produced spam. Some of it might've been vaguely funny, but it was what it was.

Anyway, this was evidently written before I realized that you could read spammed comments if you felt like it. I wouldn't have been so upset if I'd known.

name: stormagnet
text: Dude, he fucking does. Haven't you noticed how many reader comments he works into his strip later? I hope he sets his lame limit low, though; I'd hate to think that valuable entertainment-generating time was spent reading your assinine trolling.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Haven't you noticed how many reader comments he works into his strip later?

I demand examples!

Although personally I think Ray saying something along the lines of "I'll just sit here not being gay, and they'll be wrong" is directly addressed to Retardo.

name: stormagnet
text:
That was one of the prime examples I'd been thinking of, yeah. None of them are obvious or conclusive, but I really feel like there's some feedback going on.

That said though, I hadn't finished reading the whole archive when I posted this comment, and so some posts that referred to future strips I misinterpreted as having influenced said strip.

name: garlic_breath
text:
I don't think this strip is misogynistic because we are laughing at Todd and how horrible he is.

Sometimes it makes me a little sad that Achewood has so few female characters and no rounded female characters at all. But then, it's hard sometimes for men to write women. I think that it's strips like this that show that Onstad is sensitive to feminist issues. Or am I just interpreting it all wrong because I enjoy reading Achewood so much, and this strip was one of the ones that made me laugh the hardest?

name: johnbarleycorn
text: A comment left by johnbarleycorn was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by gimluck, SpinyNorman, kenyot, theyang)

name: littlefatdog
text: It is weird that there are so few female characters, but Onstad doesn't seem to have much problem writing them well. Molly's blog really seems written by an actual female; his ability to get into her character is very impressive.

name: spinynorman
text:
Molly has a pretty compassionate, understanding role. It's hard for that to be funny. Most of the funny Molly strips are when she has to deal with Beef, who is usually the source of the absurdity. Ray is neither all that compassionate and he certainly is not understanding.

Achewood is a strip about men who are still operating under the assumption that they are boys, and have similar responsibilities and morality.

name: belgand
text: But... that's all men!

name: afterward
text: Am I to understand that this comment has existed for an entire year, and I am only the fifth person to chubby it? This, a comment containing one of the most insightful sentences assetbar has witnessed?

name: layzerblade
text: But that's the point. Achewood doesn't have any characters as profoundly flawed as the boys. Tina's awful, but that's not the same.

name: mattylite
text: But what about Cornelius? How does he write women so well?

name: sp1derbaby
text: "More rounded female characters!" he said, expecting to get hell of lamed.

name: zapatos
text: We like the corpulent women.

name: epicurus
text: I don't think Todd is being held up as a positive role model here. Why is it that if sexism even appears in some media then some people have to get their panties in a knot no matter what the context is?

text:
Cannot chubby this one highly enough

If I hear a friend being positively misogynistic, racist, etc. I am stunned beyond all belief

You even expect it of Todd, he's that kind of crappy little man, but of a friend God forfend that they should act that way

It's funny 'cause it's true, but it is sadly true

Todd's apex

this is one of my favorites for the pure overload of humor that gets compounded with every panel; 'Hand-held fan' is another for the same reasons

name: nice_enuf_guy
text: As I slowly trawl the archives, working my way chronologically forward, I must admit that this is the strip that tells me I am on a noble quest. Onward I push..only 3 1/2 years to go! Thank you, fellow posters, for not spoiling to many future story lines.

text: Spoiling even one future storyline is too many ... and that has happened many times over

text: This strip is not a perfect 5. Ergo, people have voted less than 5 for it. Ergo, some people are idiots.

text: I inevitiably show this to every girl I am romantically interested in.  If they don't laugh, I stop talking to them.

text: I cannot rate this strip high enough!  I had this strip taped to my desk at work.  Nobody ever commented on it.

text: I love this strip, but I bet it REALLY lit the fuse on the tampon for some feminist out there, because in my experience, the kind of feminists that REALLY hate men also don't often comprehend the difference between satire and actual bastardry.

name: howl
text:
Q: How many feminists does it take to screw in a lightbulb?

A: That's not funny!

name: wilbur
text: The first Achewood I ever read. I loved it, but I didn't  read another one for about two years. All that time wasted!

name: stormagnet
text: You could interpret this as meaning that you got two year's worth of your Achewood dosage from this comic alone!

name: sidd2600
text: The thing is while I cannot say for sure this is my favorite strip, I have gotten more people into the comic with this than any other.

name: drago25
text: Todd almost has too much sack

name: heccibiggs
text:
Oh man, I know I'm going to get lamed for saying it but, this was my frist strip. My friend linked it to me and, wow, I TOTALLY did not get it. I was all, "dude, this is obscene and weird and not that funny", although I remember thinking Beef's "Oh my god that is the worst possible answer in the universe" was pretty cool, and really similar to something I might say.

Hahahaha but I totally didn't realise that Phillipe was supposed to be like, a child, and I thought they were talking about vice presidency like in a company, so I just thought he was a small angry CEO-type-man. I mean, lookit'im!

Of course now, I totally love it.

name: cagliostro
text:
Wh... who lamed this? How can this possibly be construed as lame?

Did someone just read as far as '...lamed', think 'fair enough', click and move on?

name: heccibiggs
text: It's probably because I said that there was a time in the distant past where I did not completely want to fellate an Achewood strip.

name: cagliostro
text:
Oh God, I don't want to fellate any Achewood strips! I was hoping for dinner at a nice restaurant, a walk by the river after dark to watch the lights on the water, maybe a shy kiss at the end of the night!

Am... am I going to get lamed?

name: rowboat
text: As much as I love this strip, there must be at least fifty that would be better to show someone who you were trying to turn on to Achewood.

name: foxtrotamend
text: This comic displays the diversity of Todd's arms.  The nonchalant shrugging makes his offensive opinions twice as funny.

name: jugglinfreak

name: maha
text: This. This is my favorite strip.

OH...OH MY GOD!

text: Even though this is my third time through the Achewood Archives, this strip has finally forced me to create a login.  5th panel... Roast Beef's expression.  Onstad has literally created the worst possible answer in the universe in relation to this question.
